fr.pyvain.websight.websight.Geometry

Class InterComputer

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.pyvain.websight.websight.Geometry.InterComputer

  • public class InterComputer
extends java.lang.Object

    A class containing tools to help generating graph drawings with reduced number of crossings.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InterComputer() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static IntersectionSet edgeIntersections(java.util.Collection<Segment> segments)
      Computes the intersections in the specified set of Segments, using the fastest method between naive and Bentley Ottmann with a data set of this size.
      static IntersectionSet edgeIntersectionsBO(java.util.Collection<Segment> segments)
      Computes the intersections in the specified set of Segments, using a simplified implementation of the Bentley Ottmann algorithm.
      static IntersectionSet edgeIntersectionsNaive(java.util.Collection<Segment> segments)
      Computes the intersections in the specified set of Segments, using a naive quadratic algorithm which consists in testing all pairs of segments For the time being, only the intersections between non parallel segments are computed, in order to make the computation faster (and easier).
      static int nbVertexCrossings(java.util.Collection<Segment> segments, java.util.Collection<CPoint> centers, float radius)
      Returns the number of times the segments of the specified set cross the circles of specified centers and radius Undefined behaviour if one of the segments is outside [-1000, 1000] x [-1000, 1000] (caused by long overflow)

    • Method Detail

      • edgeIntersections

        public static IntersectionSet edgeIntersections(java.util.Collection<Segment> segments)
        Computes the intersections in the specified set of Segments, using the fastest method between naive and Bentley Ottmann with a data set of this size. For the time being, only the intersections between non parallel segments are computed, in order to make the computation faster (and easier). Undefined behaviour if one of the segments is outside [-1000, 1000] x [-1000, 1000] (caused by long overflow)
        Parameters:
        segments - The set of segments to analyse
        Returns:
        the intersections in the specified set of segments

      • edgeIntersectionsNaive

        public static IntersectionSet edgeIntersectionsNaive(java.util.Collection<Segment> segments)
        Computes the intersections in the specified set of Segments, using a naive quadratic algorithm which consists in testing all pairs of segments For the time being, only the intersections between non parallel segments are computed, in order to make the computation faster (and easier). Undefined behaviour if one of the segments is outside [-1000, 1000] (caused by long overflow)
        Parameters:
        segments - The set of segments to analyse
        Returns:
        the intersections in the specified set of segments

      • edgeIntersectionsBO

        public static IntersectionSet edgeIntersectionsBO(java.util.Collection<Segment> segments)
        Computes the intersections in the specified set of Segments, using a simplified implementation of the Bentley Ottmann algorithm. The computation is actually done on a copy of the specified set of Segments which is disturbed a bit so that it does not contain a vertical segment, or two or more segments with the same endpoint. For the time being, only the intersections between non parallel segments are computed, in order to make the computation faster (and easier). Undefined behaviour if one of the segments is outside [-1000, 1000] x [-1000, 1000] (caused by long overflow)
        Parameters:
        segments - The set of segments to analyse
        Returns:
        the intersections in the specified set of segments

      • nbVertexCrossings

        public static int nbVertexCrossings(java.util.Collection<Segment> segments,
                                    java.util.Collection<CPoint> centers,
                                    float radius)
        Returns the number of times the segments of the specified set cross the circles of specified centers and radius Undefined behaviour if one of the segments is outside [-1000, 1000] x [-1000, 1000] (caused by long overflow)
        Parameters:
        segments - Segments to analyse
        centers - Centers of the circles to analyse
        radius - Common radius of the circles to analyse
        Returns:
        the number of times the segments of the specified set cross the circles of specified centers and radius
